title: Technology Integration and Learner Identity Development in Online Higher Education: Mathematics Education Course for Administrative Leaders

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical knowledge and fundamental digital device utilization skills
context.additional_context: Learners are managers/leaders within enterprises, aged 40+, possessing intermediate-level mathematical domain expertise. Digital devices are provided, and the program operates in an offline environment focused on summative assessments

learning_goals: Can clearly articulate their professional identity in mathematical problem-solving processes using modern e-learning theories and technological tools
Learners can reconstruct their leadership identity based on collaborative technology integration experiences with peer learners through Participatory Action Research (PAR) methodology.
Learners can apply mathematical thinking in digital environments, including AI-based technological tools, and critically analyze the impact of technology use on individual learning identities.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
